001package imagingbook.common.geometry.delaunay.chew;

011
012import java.util.AbstractSet;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.Collection;
015import java.util.Iterator;
016
017/**
018 * An ArrayList implementation of Set. An ArraySet is good for small sets; it
019 * has less overhead than a HashSet or a TreeSet.
020 *
021 * @author Paul Chew
022 *
023 * Created December 2007.  For use with Voronoi/Delaunay applet.
024 *
025 */
026public class ArraySet<E> extends AbstractSet<E> {
027
028    private ArrayList<E> items;            // Items of the set
029
030    /**
031     * Create an empty set (default initial capacity is 3).
032     */
033    public ArraySet () {
034        this(3);
035    }
036
037    /**
038     * Create an empty set with the specified initial capacity.
039     * @param initialCapacity the initial capacity
040     */
041    public ArraySet (int initialCapacity) {
042        items  = new ArrayList<E>(initialCapacity);
043    }
044
045    /**
046     * Create a set containing the items of the collection.  Any duplicate
047     * items are discarded.
048     * @param collection the source for the items of the small set
049     */
050    public ArraySet (Collection<? extends E> collection) {
051        items = new ArrayList<E>(collection.size());
052        for (E item: collection)
053            if (!items.contains(item)) items.add(item);
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Get the item at the specified index.
058     * @param index where the item is located in the ListSet
059     * @return the item at the specified index
060     * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of bounds
061     */
062    public E get (int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {
063        return items.get(index);
064    }
065
066    /**
067     * True iff any member of the collection is also in the ArraySet.
068     * @param collection the Collection to check
069     * @return true iff any member of collection appears in this ArraySet
070     */
071    public boolean containsAny (Collection<?> collection) {
072        for (Object item: collection)
073            if (this.contains(item)) return true;
074        return false;
075    }
076
077    @Override
078    public boolean add(E item) {
079        if (items.contains(item)) return false;
080        return items.add(item);
081    }
082
083    @Override
084    public Iterator<E> iterator() {
085        return items.iterator();
086    }
087
088    @Override
089    public int size() {
090        return items.size();
091    }
092
093}
